name: Hilsa Fish Curry
description: Hilsa fish curry is a popular dish in Bengali cuisine. It is made with hilsa fish along with potatoes, eggplant, lentils, green chilies, tomatoes, and various spices, including garlic and ginger, to enhance the flavor.

name: Shorshe Ilish
description: Shorshe Ilish is a traditional Bengali dish made with Hilsa fish marinated in a mustard seed paste and cooked in a tangy mustard sauce. It is known for its rich and flavorful taste.

name: Chingri Macher Malai Curry
description: Chingri Macher Malai Curry, also known as Prawn Malai Curry, is a creamy and aromatic Bengali dish made with prawns cooked in a coconut milk-based gravy. It is often served with steamed rice.

name: Shorshe Bata Diye Macher Jhal
description: Shorshe Bata Diye Macher Jhal is a spicy fish curry prepared with mustard paste, green chilies, and spices. It is a popular Bengali dish known for its bold flavors.

name: Aloo Posto
description: Aloo Posto is a classic Bengali dish made with potatoes cooked in a poppy seed paste. It is a vegetarian delicacy known for its unique flavor and simplicity.

name: Macher Matha Diye Moong Dal
description: Macher Matha Diye Moong Dal is a traditional Bengali dish made with split green gram lentils and fish head. It is a flavorful and nutritious preparation.

name: Kosha Mangsho
description: Kosha Mangsho is a slow-cooked Bengali mutton curry known for its intense flavors. The tender pieces of mutton are cooked with a blend of spices and served with steamed rice or Indian bread.

name: Shorshe Maach Bhapa
description: Shorshe Maach Bhapa is a steamed fish dish prepared with mustard paste, yogurt, and spices. It is a flavorful and healthy Bengali delicacy.

name: Luchi with Cholar Dal
description: Luchi with Cholar Dal is a popular Bengali breakfast combination. Luchi is deep-fried puffed bread made from flour, while Cholar Dal is a flavorful lentil preparation made with Bengal gram.

name: Bhapa Doi
description: Bhapa Doi is a traditional Bengali dessert made by steaming sweetened yogurt. It has a rich and creamy texture and is often flavored with cardamom or saffron.

name: Shorshe Ilish Biryani
description: Shorshe Ilish Biryani is a fragrant rice dish cooked with Hilsa fish, mustard paste, and aromatic spices. It is a unique and delicious Bengali twist on the traditional biryani.

name: Misti Doi
description: Misti Doi, meaning sweet yogurt, is a popular Bengali dessert made by fermenting sweetened milk. It has a thick and creamy texture and is served chilled.

name: Shorshe Bata Diye Bhetki Paturi
description: Shorshe Bata Diye Bhetki Paturi is a Bengali delicacy where fillets of Bhetki fish are marinated in a mustard paste, wrapped in banana leaves, and steamed to perfection.

name: Kolkata Biryani
description: Kolkata Biryani is a flavorful rice dish made with aromatic spices, basmati rice, and meat (usually chicken or mutton). It has a distinct taste and is garnished with fried onions and boiled eggs.

name: Shorshe Pabda
description: Shorshe Pabda is a Bengali fish curry made with Pabda fish cooked in a mustard sauce. The dish is known for its tangy and spicy flavors.

name: Dhokar Dalna
description: Dhokar Dalna is a traditional Bengali dish made with lentil cakes called Dhoka, cooked in a spicy and flavorful gravy made with onions, tomatoes, and spices.

name: Mutton Rezala
description: Mutton Rezala is a rich and aromatic Bengali dish made with tender mutton cooked in a creamy gravy made with yogurt, cashews, and a blend of spices.

name: Kanchkolar Kofta Curry
description: Kanchkolar Kofta Curry is a delicious Bengali curry made with raw banana (kanchkola) dumplings cooked in a flavorful gravy made with tomatoes, onions, and spices.

name: Macher Jhol
description: Macher Jhol is a light and spicy Bengali fish curry made with various fish varieties, vegetables, and spices. It is a comforting and homely dish often enjoyed with steamed rice.

name: Mishti Pulao
description: Mishti Pulao is a sweet and aromatic Bengali rice dish made with basmati rice, raisins, cashews, and flavored with whole spices. It is often served with rich and creamy Bengali curries.
